page.title: 08Didbrook Fields
page.content: {Didbrook Fields}is by owned Dansk Planteforaedling. It was founded in 1975 and has 100 acres of land. Only 4 people work on the farm. They work an average of 8 hours a day. Mr.Thomas is in charge of the farm. They test grasses for football pitches, bowling greens, parks, silage, etc. The grasses are sent from Brussels in Belgium. They own 81 cattle and they test the grasses on the cattle. In the larger plots they grow silage grasses such as Perenniel and Italian Rye, Coxford, Timothy, Lucerne, Red and White Clover. At 09.00 in the winter and 10.00 in the summer they record the results of the Stevenson's screen. For drainage in the fields they use para ploughs and pipes. Para ploughs dig deep into the earth to let the water drain away.
